column5: In an earlier post I had asked what fillet knife would be good for perch, since I was using a berkley fillet knife before and it just couldn't cut very well and sharpening it was a nightmare, just wouldn't keep its edge. So I watch a video on YouTube of Darryl Choronzey watching another guy(Russel Mckay) fillet Walleye and the guy was amazing at it and he recommended Rapala fillet knives. I went and I got one at Crappy Tire and just used it today on a few decent sized perch and WOW, what a difference it makes. It came with a very good ceramic sharpener and it just beats the berkley knife hands down.  So if you looking for a good fillet knife that isn't expensive, think about getting a Rapala fillet knife. I got the 6" for 16$ and its very worth looking into. I'm pretty new to filleting fish and that video and the knife help allot.  Walleye Video: Pike Video:
Yep, I buy a new rapala one every time they're on sale
Perch are one of the worst fish for knives. Usually have to smooth the edge after every few fish if you want a clean cut.
YEP. I have the knife that my Dad tought me how to clean fish with(RAPALA)35yrs ago works like a charm easy to sharpen(all I see is bones when I use it.)

I still have the Rapala knife my Gram bought for me in the old country over 40 years back. The blade is getting a bit thin and the sheath is dark with age and abuse but I love it. Perch are brutal on a blade. Constantly need to resharpen.
All I use is rapala here's a new one I just got
